configSLA.name: configSLA
configSLA.description: This object represents whether SLA is enabled or disabled on this unit.

unitSamplingPeriodForFDR_DDR.name: unitSamplingPeriodForFDR_DDR
unitSamplingPeriodForFDR_DDR.description: This object is to configure the sampling period in minutes for Frame Delivery Ratio and Data Delivery Ratio. The default is 1 minute.

unitSamplingPeriodForDelayMeasurement.name: unitSamplingPeriodForDelayMeasurement
unitSamplingPeriodForDelayMeasurement.description: This object is to configure the sampling period in minutes for Delay Measurements. The default is 1 minute.

unitThresholdForFDR.name: unitThresholdForFDR
unitThresholdForFDR.description: This object is to configure the threshold in one thousandth of a percentage for Frame Delivery Ratio. A value of 0 disables the trap altogether.

unitThresholdForDDR.name: unitThresholdForDDR
unitThresholdForDDR.description: This object is to configure the threshold in one thousandth of a percentage for Data Delivery Ratio. A value of 0 disables the trap altogether.

unitDelayMeasurementPacketSize.name: unitDelayMeasurementPacketSize
unitDelayMeasurementPacketSize.description: This object is to configure the size in bytes of Delay Measurement Packets, one size of all DLCIs.

unitOamDomainIdentifier.name: unitOamDomainIdentifier
unitOamDomainIdentifier.description: This object is the Domain Identifier for OA&M protocol. All end points participating in this SLA measurement must have the SAME OA&M Domain Identifier. The default is 0.

unitOamLocationIdentifier.name: unitOamLocationIdentifier
unitOamLocationIdentifier.description: This object is the Location Identifier for OA&M protocol. All end points participating in this SLA measurement must have a unique OA&M Location Identifier.

configurationPerDLCIEntry.name: configurationPerDLCIEntry
configurationPerDLCIEntry.description: An entry in the Configuration per DLCI table.

configurationPerDLCITableIndex.name: configurationPerDLCITableIndex
configurationPerDLCITableIndex.description: The index of Configuration Per DLCI table, which is DLCI number.

commitedInformationRatePerDLCI.name: commitedInformationRatePerDLCI
commitedInformationRatePerDLCI.description: This is the DLCI's Committed Information Rate (CIR). The CIR can be discovered automatically if LMI Rev 1.0 is used. If Annex A or Annex D is used, then the CIR must be entered manually in the DLCI table. The DLCI table is in the enterprise MIB.

remoteDLCIPerDLCI.name: remoteDLCIPerDLCI
remoteDLCIPerDLCI.description: DLCI of the far end unit on each DLCI, which is discovered using Frame Relay OA&M Protocol. It will be stored in volatile memory.

remoteIpAddressPerDLCI.name: remoteIpAddressPerDLCI
remoteIpAddressPerDLCI.description: IP Address of the NET port of the far end unit on each DLCI, which is discovered using Frame Relay OA&M Protocol. It will be stored in volatile memory.

thresholdForDelayMeasurementsPerDLCI.name: thresholdForDelayMeasurementsPerDLCI
thresholdForDelayMeasurementsPerDLCI.description: This object represents this DLCI's delay threshold in milliseconds. The default is 64000. A value of 0 disables the trap altogether.

deliveryRatioPerDLCITable.name: deliveryRatioPerDLCITable
deliveryRatioPerDLCITable.description: Lifetime Delivery counter Table Per DLCI, contains both Frame Delivery Ratio and Data Delivery Ratio.

deliveryRatioPerDLCIEntry.name: deliveryRatioPerDLCIEntry
deliveryRatioPerDLCIEntry.description: An entry in the Delivery Ratio table.

deliveryRatioPerDLCITableIndex.name: deliveryRatioPerDLCITableIndex
deliveryRatioPerDLCITableIndex.description: The index of Delivery Ratio Table, which is the same value as configurationPerDLCITableIndex.

deliveryTableEncodedValue.name: deliveryTableEncodedValue
deliveryTableEncodedValue.description: This object represents the value of the whole row of the table. If the table. The intent of object is to increase the efficiency of retrieving the table. For each object value in this table, which are all of Counter type, it will be represented with 4 bytes of data. The byte order of the Counter value will be MSB ... LSB. This object will contain the value of all objects on the table, except 'deliveryRatioPerDLCITableIndex'.

deliveryTableTimestamp.name: deliveryTableTimestamp
deliveryTableTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the last sample for delivery Entry statistics. Each time the near end of the DLCI receives Delivery Ratio Results Information Field, this number will contain the unit's current timestamp. A timestamp is a 32-bit number representing the number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00AM, January 1, 1970.

fTCLperDLCI.name: fTCLperDLCI
fTCLperDLCI.description: Number of frames transmitted at the near end within CIR on this DLCI.

fTELperDLCI.name: fTELperDLCI
fTELperDLCI.description: Number of frames transmitted at the near end above CIR on this DLCI

fRCLperDLCI.name: fRCLperDLCI
fRCLperDLCI.description: Number of frames received at the near end on this DLCI within CIR. These frames will have the Discard Eligible (DE) bit reset.

fRELperDLCI.name: fRELperDLCI
fRELperDLCI.description: Number of frames received at the near end on this DLCI above CIR. These frames will have the Discard Eligible (DE) bit set.

fTCRperDLCI.name: fTCRperDLCI
fTCRperDLCI.description: Number of frames transmitted at the far end within CIR on this DLCI.

fTERperDLCI.name: fTERperDLCI
fTERperDLCI.description: Number of frames transmitted at the far end above CIR on this DLCI.

fRCRperDLCI.name: fRCRperDLCI
fRCRperDLCI.description: Number of frames received at the far end on this DLCI within CIR. These frames will have the Discard Eligible (DE) bit reset.

fRERperDLCI.name: fRERperDLCI
fRERperDLCI.description: Number of frames received at the far end on this DLCI above CIR. These frames will have the Discard Eligible (DE) bit set.

fDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.name: fDRNumberOfSamplesTaken
fDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.description: Number of samples taken for Frame Delivery Statistics. Each time the near end receives the Frame Delivery Ratio Results Information Field, this counter will be incremented.

fDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.name: fDRNumberOfThresholdViolations
fDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.description: Number of threshold violations for Frame Delivery. FDRCL = fRCRPerDLCI / fTCLPerDLCI FDRCR = fRCLPerDLCI / fTCRPerDLCI For each sample, FDRCL and FDRCR are compared to the threshold configured on object 'unitThresholdForFDR'. When either FDRCL or FDRCR is less than the threshold, this counter is incremented.

dTCLperDLCI.name: dTCLperDLCI
dTCLperDLCI.description: Number of bytes transmitted to the network within CIR on this DLCI.

dTELperDLCI.name: dTELperDLCI
dTELperDLCI.description: Number of bytes transmitted to the network above CIR on this DLCI

dRCLperDLCI.name: dRCLperDLCI
dRCLperDLCI.description: Number of bytes received at the near end on this DLCI within CIR. These frames will have the Discard Eligible (DE) bit reset.

dRELperDLCI.name: dRELperDLCI
dRELperDLCI.description: Number of bytes received at the near end of this DLCI above CIR. These frames will have the Discard Eligible (DE) bit set.

dTCRperDLCI.name: dTCRperDLCI
dTCRperDLCI.description: Number of bytes transmitted at the far end within CIR on this DLCI.

dTERperDLCI.name: dTERperDLCI
dTERperDLCI.description: Number of bytes transmitted at the far end above CIR on this DLCI.

dRCRperDLCI.name: dRCRperDLCI
dRCRperDLCI.description: Number of bytes received at the far end on this DLCI above CIR. These frames will have the Discard Eligible (DE) bit reset.

dRERperDLCI.name: dRERperDLCI
dRERperDLCI.description: Number of bytes received at the far end on his DLCI above CIR. These frames will have the Discard Eligible (DE) bit set.

dDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.name: dDRNumberOfSamplesTaken
dDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.description: Number of samples taken for Data Delivery statistics. Each time the near end receives the Data Delivery Ratio Results Information Field, this counter will be incremented.

dDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.name: dDRNumberOfThresholdViolations
dDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.description: Number of threshold violations for Data Delivery statistics. DDRCL = dRCRPerDLCI / dTCLPerDLCI DDRCR = dRCLPerDLCI / dTCRPerDLCI For each sample, DDRCL and DDRCR are compared to the threshold configured on object 'unitThresholdForDDR'. When either DDRCL or DDRCR is less than the threshold, this counter is incremented.

txFDRTimestamp.name: txFDRTimestamp
txFDRTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the last sample for delivery Entry statistics. Each time the near end of the DLCI receives Delivery Ratio Results Information Field, this number will contain the unit's current timestamp. A timestamp is a 32-bit number representing the number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00AM, January 1, 1970.

txFDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.name: txFDRNumberOfSamplesTaken
txFDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.description: Number of samples taken for Frame Delivery Statistics. Each time the near end receives the Frame Delivery Ratio Results Information Field, this counter will be incremented.

txFDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.name: txFDRNumberOfThresholdViolations
txFDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.description: Number of threshold violations for Frame Delivery. FDRCL = fRCRPerDLCI / fTCLPerDLCI For each sample, FDRCL is compared to the threshold configured on object 'unitThresholdForFDR'. When FDRCL is less than the threshold, this counter is incremented.

rxFDRTimestamp.name: rxFDRTimestamp
rxFDRTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the last sample for delivery Entry statistics. Each time the near end of the DLCI receives Delivery Ratio poll, this number will contain the unit's current timestamp. A timestamp is a 32-bit number representing the number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00AM, January 1, 1970.

rxFDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.name: rxFDRNumberOfSamplesTaken
rxFDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.description: Number of samples taken for Frame Delivery Statistics. Each time the near end receives the Frame Delivery Ratio poll, this counter will be incremented.

rxFDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.name: rxFDRNumberOfThresholdViolations
rxFDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.description: Number of threshold violations for Frame Delivery. FDRCR = fRCLPerDLCI / fTCRPerDLCI For each sample, FDRCR is compared to the threshold configured on object 'unitThresholdForFDR'. When FDRCR is less than the threshold, this counter is incremented.

txDDRTimestamp.name: txDDRTimestamp
txDDRTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the last sample for delivery Entry statistics. Each time the near end of the DLCI receives Delivery Ratio Results Information Field, this number will contain the unit's current timestamp. A timestamp is a 32-bit number representing the number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00AM, January 1, 1970.

txDDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.name: txDDRNumberOfSamplesTaken
txDDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.description: Number of samples taken for DataDelivery Statistics. Each time the near end receives the Data Delivery Ratio Results Information Field, this counter will be incremented.

txDDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.name: txDDRNumberOfThresholdViolations
txDDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.description: Number of threshold violations for Data Delivery. DDRCL = dRCRPerDLCI / dTCLPerDLCI For each sample, DDRCL is compared to the threshold configured on object 'unitThresholdForDDR'. When DDRCL is less than the threshold, this counter is incremented.

rxDDRTimestamp.name: rxDDRTimestamp
rxDDRTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the last sample for delivery Entry statistics. Each time the near end of the DLCI receives Delivery Ratio poll, this number will contain the unit's current timestamp. A timestamp is a 32-bit number representing the number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00AM, January 1, 1970.

rxDDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.name: rxDDRNumberOfSamplesTaken
rxDDRNumberOfSamplesTaken.description: Number of samples taken for Data Delivery Statistics. Each time the near end receives the Data Delivery Ratio poll, this counter will be incremented.

rxDDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.name: rxDDRNumberOfThresholdViolations
rxDDRNumberOfThresholdViolations.description: Number of threshold violations for Data Delivery. DDRCR = dRCLPerDLCI / dTCRPerDLCI For each sample, DDRCR is compared to the threshold configured on object 'unitThresholdForDDR'. When DDRCR is less than the threshold, this counter is incremented.

txDiscardEligible.name: txDiscardEligible
txDiscardEligible.description: Number of Discard Eligible counters transmitted at the near end. This counter has the same value as object 'etherStatsFragments' in RMON MIB (RFC 1757) for DTE port.

rxDiscardEligible.name: rxDiscardEligible
rxDiscardEligible.description: Number of Discard Eligible counters received by the near end. This counter has the same value as object 'etherStatsFragments' in RMON MIB (RFC 1757) for DCE port

txFECN.name: txFECN
txFECN.description: Number of FECN counters transmitted at the near end. This counter has the same value as object 'etherStatsCollisions' in RMON MIB (RFC 1757) for DTE port.

rxFECN.name: rxFECN
rxFECN.description: Number of FECN counters received by the near end. This counter has the same value as object 'etherStatsCollisions' in RMON MIB (RFC 1757) for DCE port.

txBECN.name: txBECN
txBECN.description: Number of BECN counters transmitted at the near end. This counter has the same value as object 'etherStatsJabbers' in RMON MIB (RFC 1757) for DTE port.

rxBECN.name: rxBECN
rxBECN.description: Number of BECN counters received by the near end. This counter has the same value as object 'etherStatsJabbers' in RMON MIB (RFC 1757) for DCE port.

delayPerDLCIEntry.name: delayPerDLCIEntry
delayPerDLCIEntry.description: An entry in the Delay per DLCI table.

delayPerDLCITableIndex.name: delayPerDLCITableIndex
delayPerDLCITableIndex.description: The index of Delay Table, which is DLCI number.

delayTableEncodedValue.name: delayTableEncodedValue
delayTableEncodedValue.description: This object represents the value of the whole row of the table. If the table. The intent of object is to increase the efficiency of retrieving the table. For each object value in this table, which are all of Counter type, it will be represented with 4 bytes of data. The byte order of the Counter value will be MSB ... LSB. This object will contain the value of all objects on the table, except 'delayPerDLCITableIndex'.

delayTableTimestamp.name: delayTableTimestamp
delayTableTimestamp.description: Timestamp for Delay Table entry. Each time the near end of the DLCI receives an OA&M message containing a Frame Transfer Delay Information Field, this number will contain the unit's current timestamp. A timestamp is a 32-bit number representing the number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00AM, January 1, 1970.

totalRoundTripDelayPerDLCI.name: totalRoundTripDelayPerDLCI
totalRoundTripDelayPerDLCI.description: Sum of all the round trip delay measurements taken so far.

maximumRoundTripDelayNSamplesPerDLCI.name: maximumRoundTripDelayNSamplesPerDLCI
maximumRoundTripDelayNSamplesPerDLCI.description: Maximum Round Trip Delay in last n samples. N is 15.

maximumRoundTripDelay2NSamplesPerDLCI.name: maximumRoundTripDelay2NSamplesPerDLCI
maximumRoundTripDelay2NSamplesPerDLCI.description: Maximum Round Trip Delay in last 2N samples. N is 15.

maximumRoundTripDelay4NSamplesPerDLCI.name: maximumRoundTripDelay4NSamplesPerDLCI
maximumRoundTripDelay4NSamplesPerDLCI.description: Maximum Round Trip Delay in last 4n samples. N is 15.

numberOfDelayMeasurementsPerDLCI.name: numberOfDelayMeasurementsPerDLCI
numberOfDelayMeasurementsPerDLCI.description: Number of delay measurements per DLCI. Each time the near end receives an OA&M message containing a Frame Transfer Delay Information Field, this counter will be incremented.

delayNumberOfThresholdViolations.name: delayNumberOfThresholdViolations
delayNumberOfThresholdViolations.description: Number of threshold violations on Delay measurement. If an individual delay measurement on this DLCI is greater than the threshold value configured in object 'thresholdForDelayMeasurementPerDLCI', this counter will be incremented.

outagePerDLCIEntry.name: outagePerDLCIEntry
outagePerDLCIEntry.description: An entry in the Outage per DLCI table.

outageTableIndex.name: outageTableIndex
outageTableIndex.description: Index of Outage Table, which is the DLCI number.

outageTableEncodedValue.name: outageTableEncodedValue
outageTableEncodedValue.description: This object represents the value of the whole row of the table. If the table. The intent of object is to increase the efficiency of retrieving the table. For each object value in this table, which are all of Counter type, it will be represented with 4 bytes of data. The byte order of the Counter value will be MSB ... LSB. This object will contain the value of all objects on the table, except 'outageTableIndex'.

outageTableTimestamp.name: outageTableTimestamp
outageTableTimestamp.description: Timestamp of when this Outage Table entry last updated. A timestamp is a 32-bit number representing the number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00AM, January 1, 1970.

periodOfOutages.name: periodOfOutages
periodOfOutages.description: The sum total of how long the outages are.

periodOfExcludedOutages.name: periodOfExcludedOutages
periodOfExcludedOutages.description: The sum total of how long excluded outages are.

outageTableLastTimestamp.name: outageTableLastTimestamp
outageTableLastTimestamp.description: This object contains timestamp (in seconds) of the last time 'outagePerDLCITable' is updated (changed).

fDRThresholdTrap.name: fDRThresholdTrap
fDRThresholdTrap.description: This trap will be sent if 'fDRNumberOfThresholdViolations' is incremented. The VARIABLES contain the DLCI number whose Frame Delivery Ratio threshold violation is updated.

dDRThresholdTrap.name: dDRThresholdTrap
dDRThresholdTrap.description: This trap will be sent if 'dDRNumberOfThresholdViolations' is incremented. The VARIABLES contain the DLCI number whose Data Delivery Ratio threshold violation is updated.

delayThresholdTrap.name: delayThresholdTrap
delayThresholdTrap.description: This trap will be sent if 'delayNumberOfThresholdViolations' is incremented. The VARIABLES contain the DLCI number whose Delay threshold violation is updated.
